uniform title durgā arcana ṣṛti
authoḥ lakṣmīnārāyaṇa goswāmī

original: Description: This is modern manual for the worship of the goddess Durgā. It was written by Lakṣmīnārāyaṇa Goswāmī a Bengali brahmin who was professsor of the Sanskrit College of the Vidyādharmavarddhinī Pāṭhaśālā in Agra where he taught Yajurveda. He was also an expert in ritual . The manual was published in 1952 with a commentary (bhāṣātikā) by his son Ghanaśyāma Gosvaāmī.
analyzed: description this is modern manual for the worship of the goddess durgā it was written by lakṣmīnārāyaṇa gosvāmī a bengali brahmin who was professsor of the sanskrit college of the vidyādharmavarddhinī pāṭhaśālā in agra where he taught yajurveda he was also an expert in ritual the manual was published in with a commentary bhāṣātikā by his son ghanaśyāma gosvaāmī

original: The rite is extensively described with all the details neccesary to do it competely just by following the directions given in the book. The full rite which is quite extensive is primarily performed during the period of Navaraatri in combination, as usual, with the recitation of the Durgāsāsaptaśati drawn from the Mārkaṇḍeyapurāṇa. The layout is very clear and systematic allowing anyone with a basic knowledge of ritual performance and Sanskrit to do the rites. It has therefore been a very popular work throughout North India.
